thread.title: NASA’s expedition to Mars will need new rockets, new life support technology and a new type of astronaut
thread.title_full: NASA’s expedition to Mars will need new rockets, new life support technology and a new type of astronaut

title: NASA’s expedition to Mars will need new rockets, new life support technology and a new type of astronaut
text:
It’s been over 40 years since Neil Armstrong became the poster boy for what is arguably humanity’s greatest achievement to date - the first human footprint on the moon.
But that one giant leap is about to get a whole lot bigger.
NASA is now preparing for the most ambitious, daring and downright dangerous voyage any person has ever taken - one that will get human beings walking around on the surface of Mars.
It will be no typical feat of science either - getting to the red planet would involve a journey of at least three years, with the threat of sudden death hanging over the astronauts at every second.
In the visually stunning documentary below, the BBC meets the scientists and engineers who are designing new rockets, new space suits and finding ways to help astronauts survive the perils of this long voyage.
And it turns out that having the ‘right stuff’ for a mission to Mars might not be quite what you expect.
Man on Mars - Mission to the Red Planet 49:47 Play video
Getting to the red planet would involve a journey of at least three years. Meet the scientists and engineers working out how to overcome the problems associated with sending humans 56 million kilometres from earth.
Oovvuu 04 May 2015 TV/Science TV/Technology TV/Documentary Is there life on Mars?... a little patience and the answer will soon be yes. Source: Supplied
You can check out more feature documentaries in our catalogue here whenever you want - completely free.
